ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Neurofibromatosis type 2 (NF2)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed by MRI showing bilateral vestibular schwannomas and other intracranial tumors.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear pathology (Vestibular Schwannoma)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by asymmetric SNHL, significant WRS rollover, absent acoustic reflexes, and abnormal ABR.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sudden Idiopathic Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial presentation of sudden onset, but ruled out by identification of tumors.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity given complaints of sudden hearing loss.
To assess word recognition and check for rollover indicative of retrocochlear pathology.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc; absence or decay can indicate retrocochlear pathology.
To distinguish between cochlear and retrocochlear sites of lesion.
To assess neural synchrony and retrocochlear function given asymmetric findings.
To assess central auditory pathway function.
Definitive imaging to visualize potential tumors in the internal auditory canal or cerebellopontine angle.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with mild right SNHL and normal left hearing. However, a battery of diagnostic tests strongly indicates retrocochlear pathology, particularly on the right side (rollover, absent reflexes, abnormal ABR). MRI confirms the diagnosis of Neurofibromatosis type 2 with bilateral vestibular schwannomas.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear normal (â‰¤ 15 dB HL); Right ear mild mid- and high-frequency SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left WRS 96% at 80 dB HL; Right WRS 96% at 60 dB HL rolling over to 56% at 80 dB HL (Rollover Index 0.42).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent with right ear stimulation (ipsi and contra); normal with left ear stimulation.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (OAE)
tests.result_summary: Normal and symmetric TEOAEs bilaterally, suggesting intact cochlear function despite hearing loss.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Only Wave I present. Left ear: Prolonged Wave I-V interval (4.8 ms).

tests.name: MRI
tests.result_summary: Bilateral vestibular schwannomas (Right 2 cm, Left 2.5 cm), olfactory meningioma, and glomus jugulare tumor.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Significant decline in hearing sensitivity and speech recognition bilaterally over 5 years.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear progressed to moderate mid-frequency SNHL; Right ear progressed to moderate-to-severe high-frequency SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left WRS decreased to 70% at 80 dB HL; Right WRS dropped to 0% at all intensities.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent with right ear stimulation. Left ipsilateral reflex absent (suggesting left facial nerve involvement); left contralateral reflex preserved.

counseling_actions: Explain the diagnosis of Neurofibromatosis type 2 (NF2) and the presence of bilateral tumors.
Discuss the 'structure versus function' discrepancy, where tumor size does not always correlate with hearing loss severity.
Explain the cause of speech understanding difficulties (rollover) in the right ear.
Counsel on the decision to monitor rather than operate due to the number and location of tumors.

red_flags_present: Absent acoustic reflexes with mild hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: MRI is required to confirm retrocochlear pathology suggested by audiometric and electrophysiological findings.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Close follow-up (seen 5 years later in outcome)
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor tumor growth and progression of hearing loss.
